bibl.title: A Survey of Wormholes in Soph. frr. 206-213 R.2 (P.Oxy. IX 1175 + XVII 2018[b], frr. 1-8 Hunt).
Archiv für Papyrusforschung und verwandte Gebiete

bibl.note: Analyses some recurring features, such as wormholes on the surface, in P. Oxy. IX, 1175 + XVII, 2081 (b) (= M.-P.3 1472; LDAB 3930). These features provide clues for the order of the fragments and the sequence of the columns, and thus for the reconstruction of the tragedy. - 1. The ῥῆσις and Astyoche's lament (fr. 210 R.2). - 2. The choral ode after the ῥῆσις and the burial of the corpse (frr. 211, 212, 213, 222b5 R.2). - 3. Fragmentary dialogues (frr. 206, 206a, 208 R.2)? - 4. Crowns, sirens and the misinterpreted presage. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Giulio Iovine, A Survey of Wormholes in Soph. frr. 206-213 R.2 (P.Oxy. IX 1175 + XVII 2018[b], frr. 1-8 Hunt).

Analyses some recurring features, such as wormholes on the surface, in P. Oxy. IX, 1175 + XVII, 2081 (b) (= M.-P.3 1472; LDAB 3930). These features provide clues for the order of the fragments and the sequence of the columns, and thus for the reconstruction of the tragedy. - 1. The ῥῆσις and Astyoche's lament (fr. 210 R.2). - 2. The choral ode after the ῥῆσις and the burial of the corpse (frr. 211, 212, 213, 222b5 R.2). - 3. Fragmentary dialogues (frr. 206, 206a, 208 R.2)? - 4. Crowns, sirens and the misinterpreted presage. - Avec résumé en anglais.
